title: dialog role
description: A dialog is a descendant window of the primary window of a web application. For HTML pages, the primary application window is the entire web document, i.e., the body element.

assertions.rationale: Users must be made aware of the dialog context.

assertions.title: convey the name of the dialog
assertions.rationale: Users need to know the purpose of the dialog.

assertions.title: convey the boundaries of the dialog
assertions.rationale: Users need to know when they enter and exit a dialog.
examples: Screen readers might announce something like "entering dialog" or "leaving dialog".
Screen readers might imply the boundary by obscuring outside content when aria-modal=true is also present.

assertions.title: automatically switch away from reading mode
